briefTitle: One Year Antibody Persistence After a Fourth Dose Boost or Two Catch-Up Doses of Novartis Meningococcal B Recombinant Vaccine Administered Starting From 12 Months of Age and Response to a Third Dose Boost or Two Catch-Up Doses Starting at 24 Months of Age
officialTitle: A Phase 3, Open-Label, Multi-Center, Extension Study of V72P13E1 to Assess Antibody Persistence at One Year After a Fourth Dose Boost or Two Catch-Up Doses of Novartis Meningococcal B Recombinant Vaccine Administered Starting at 12 Months of Age and to Evaluate the Response to a Third Dose Boost or Two Catch-Up Doses Starting at 24 Months of Age
summary: One year antibody persistence after the fourth dose boost or two catch-up doses administered starting from 12 months of age and to evaluate the response to a a third dose boost or two catch-up dose starting at 24 months of age.

primaryOutcome.measure: Geometric Mean Titers (GMTs) to Assess Antibody Persistence at 12 Months After a Booster Dose of rMenB+OMV NZ Vaccination.
